intro: Mollia longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved mollia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features elongated, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Mollia longifolia typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique type of shrubland found in the Western Cape region of South Africa.
